Sentencas: A perovskite-like CaV1-xMoxO3-delta (x = 0.2 divided by 0.6) were prepared by a formate solution method with the final annealing at 1473 K in an H-2 atmosphere.
Titulo: The effect of Mo concentration on the electrical properties of CaV1-xMoxO3-δ (x=0.2 ÷ 0.6) anode materials for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: X-ray diffraction analysis was used for sample characterisation.
Titulo: The effect of Mo concentration on the electrical properties of CaV1-xMoxO3-δ (x=0.2 ÷ 0.6) anode materials for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Metallike electric conductivity was observed using a 4-probe DC technique from 573 to 1123 K in dry H-2.
Titulo: The effect of Mo concentration on the electrical properties of CaV1-xMoxO3-δ (x=0.2 ÷ 0.6) anode materials for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Magnetic susceptibility measurements showed the absence of localised V and Mo valence electrons.
Titulo: The effect of Mo concentration on the electrical properties of CaV1-xMoxO3-δ (x=0.2 ÷ 0.6) anode materials for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The Seebeck coefficient was measured between temperatures of 573-1123 K in dry H-2, supporting the hypothesis that electronic conductivity is predominant.
Titulo: The effect of Mo concentration on the electrical properties of CaV1-xMoxO3-δ (x=0.2 ÷ 0.6) anode materials for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Thermal expansion coefficients (TEC) are obtained by dilatometry from 373 to 1123 K in dry H-2.
Titulo: The effect of Mo concentration on the electrical properties of CaV1-xMoxO3-δ (x=0.2 ÷ 0.6) anode materials for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: TEC values increase with temperature from 10 ppm to 15 ppm K-1 and decrease with Mo concentration.
Titulo: The effect of Mo concentration on the electrical properties of CaV1-xMoxO3-δ (x=0.2 ÷ 0.6) anode materials for solid oxide fuel cells
